body.name: Bambaw Safety Razor for Women with 5 Double Edge Safety Razor Blades, Double Edge Razor, Reusable Razor, Plastic Free – Rose Gold
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 10 mins

climatePledgeFriendly.details: Climate neutral by ClimatePartner certifies the carbon footprint of a product was calculated and all associated emissions were offset.

features: THE PERFECT SHAVE: Make skin irritations and ingrown hair a problem of the past. With the safety razor for women, you will achieve the closest shave effortlessly.
DURABLE: Bambaw’s reusable razors for women are built to last a lifetime. The metal razor is made from high-quality, durable materials. The safety razors are the ideal sustainable gifts for women.

INCLUDE 5 SAFETY RAZOR BLADES: These high-quality stainless-steel razor blades are designed to resist corrosion, ensuring their durability and sharpness for a long-lasting, close and clean shave. Each blade is carefully wrapped in wax paper, ensuring safe and convenient handling.

ECO-FRIENDLY: Disposable plastic razors are unrecyclable, especially the cartridges. With this metal shaver, you only need to replace the double edged razor blades. The perfect razor for eco friendly shaving.

COST EFFECTIVE: With a Bambaw ladies safety razor, you only need to rebuy the eco razor blades. Reusable razors for women save money in the long run, provide a better shave and promote sustainability.

USER MANUAL: The rose gold safety razor comes with a digital shaving manual. It provides instructions for achieving a perfect shave on various body parts, along with tips for prolonging blade and razor lifespan and responsible recycling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just a DE89 Clone - Get it if the $9 discount is essential to you
reviews.reviewText: This razor cloned the typical DE Razor head from the Edwin Jagger DE89/Muhle R89. It's a great shaver, with a nice weight to it, and all for a decent price that's less than $20. Can't complain at all, though the Edwin Jagger DE89 is only $25 or so and the fit and finish is definitely better on that. I can't say for sure where I fall on a star rating for this since to me, the extra few bucks is worth getting the better-made original that this bambaw razor was cloned from. Maybe you're different. Regardless it's great value for money so I can't fault it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best way to save on razors
reviews.reviewText: I had a safety razor before and after getting a new one I don't know why I didn't get a replacement. I know there's this whole thing like "more blades are better" but I will swear by the closeness and efficiency of a classic safety razor! Not to mention that it's much more cost effective to buy razor blades than disposable razor (just please be sure to dispose of the blades safely). If that wasn't enough it also comes in a cute color!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have not used it yet. The razor looks beautiful and it's nice and heavy. However, when just opening it to look at it there was a bug that made a nest of some sort in the razor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really happy with this razor but sticking with Bambaw razor blades. Color is a little off too.
reviews.reviewText: This is my first safety razor and so far I've been very happy. I nearly purchased a much more expensive safety razor but I'm glad I saved money with this one. I was just looking to get away from disposable razors due to cost and waste but I've been happy that these are a better shave too. It has been less irritating for my face as long as I stick to Bambaw blades. I tried some Dorco blades and that was awful (scratchy feeling and pulled on my hairs). I don't know if the blades or the safety razor were to blame. I'll just stick to Bambaw blades, they're a little more pricy but still overall cheaper than plastic disposables. I ordered the black razor but this isn't a true black. More of a dark gunmetal with a little brown in it too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic introduction to safety razors!
reviews.reviewText: I've used this safety razor regularly for 1.5 years now and, as an intruduction to the world of safety razors, it has served me excellently!After using this, I cannot imagine going back to the wasteful and expensive disposable razors. It isn't nearly as difficult to use as people make it out to be and I find I've nicked myself far less than when using disposable razors(almost always due to user error, make sure to replace your blade as soon as it begins getting dull!).My advice is to stop thinking and just buy it! It will serve as a longtime and valuable companion. Also, the stand is definitely worth the extra, it is suprisingly convenient.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Left a smooth shave. I wasn’t even being that careful and I didn’t cut myself. Some people need to read directions…Don’t press into your skin like a regular leg razor. Looks great and more sustainable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Color flakes off
reviews.reviewText: This is a good quality, sturdy razor and the color looked great, but sadly it has been coming off in flakes. I've only used this razor about 4 times and have not treated it harshly. It was past my return window, but I reached out to customer support (directly, not through amazon) and they offered to mail a replacement. Just a little bit disappointing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good beginner safety razor
reviews.reviewText: Listen, safety razors ain’t for everyone. It takes time to learn, takes skill to use, you’re probably gonna cut yourself here and there, and you can’t rush it. With that being said, once you get it down, it gives you a much higher quality shave than a disposable razor and with less irritation.This is an excellent razor for those wanting to see if using a safety razor is for them. It’s not expensive, it’s durable, and it looks great. I learned with this and it helped me out a lot when it came to skin irritation and calming down my rosacea.I highly recommend learning to shave with a safety razor through various YouTube videos. There are lots of very informative ones out there and I also recommend using a good shave soap or cream. You don’t have to, but it’ll make the experience more enjoyable (I use a brand called Southern Witchcrafts, they are soooo good).One extra thing I will say is this; there is no perfect razor. A safety razor will give you a less irritable and pleasant shave, but it takes time and skill. On days that I’m in a hurry, I still use a disposable razor, but it’s at the cost of skin irritation and are more expensive in the long run with the price of cartridge replacements. If you are thinking that a safety razor is gonna save time, it will not. Once you get good with them though, you’ll be disappointed on days that you have to use a disposable razor.

I switched to safety razors less than a year ago because the cost of cartridges is nuts and electric shavers just don't give me a close enough shave. I purchased a safety razor bundled set with a butterfly style razor and oils and creams and so on and it was fine but I had to shave at night because I was always left with red rashes that would take a few hours to clear up. One day I had seen an ad for the Henson shaver and the design concept made a lot of sense (in regards to eliminating the rash) but the price was a little steep. I looked through Amazon for a three piece shaver with a similar design and settled on the Bambaw. The build of the Bambaw is sturdy and it has a good weight. The blade that comes with the shaver is dull and after a few pointless strokes I swapped it out for an Astra. The shave was great. No nicks, no rash; just a smooth, clean and close shave. I can shave in the morning again. The stand is hefty and sleek and is just an extra 3 bucks. For the price, quality, and performance this safety razor is highly recommended.

Decidí comprarme este tipo de rastrillo ya que gastaba mucho en comprar navajas cada 2 meses, a mi esposa y mi hija no les gusta mi barba porque las irritó así que me tengo que rasurar cada semana, en lo personal no me gusta rasurarme porque lo tengo que hacer muy seguido y me irritó con facilidad, pero este rastrillo no, lo hago en menos pasadas y no tengo problema alguno, solo tener que limpiar bn el rastrillo al terminar pero hay en fuera una maravilla 100% recomendado, tardo 3 días en llegar apesar de que se demoró en aduana pero llegó a tiempo muy buen producto

Bonjour je recommande ce rasoir de couleur à concierge très design est très pratique très facile d'utilisation très conforme à la description du produit avant commande prix très attractifs juste a commandé les bonnes lame du rasoir.Le poids du rasoir est très correct de son utilisation très facile le prix très abordable et je recommande ce produit.J'adore je suis fan de cette couleur.

Ich bin einfach nur begeistert.Hatte jahrelang gezögert mir einen Rasierhobel zu kaufen , weil ich dachte man schneidet sich sehr schnell und mit nur einer Klinge wird das Ergebnis nicht gut... Ich habe mir zunächst ein paar Vodeos zur Handhabung angeschaut.Dann habe ich den Rasierhobel ohne Klinge auf der Haut bewegt . Hatte ein gutes Gefühl und war verwundert und dachte, dass wenn es mit der Klinge sich genauso anfühlen wird ist alles gut.Trotzdem war ich voller Ehrfurcht und habe mir Zeit genommen.Was soll ich sagen , die Trockenübung fühlte sich genauso an wie mit Klinge.Zum ersten Mal hatte ich nach dem Rasieren kein brennen, keine Irritation ,die Haut ist super glatt. Hab mich nur einmal minimal geschnitten, weil ich Druck ausgeübt habe.Diese Klinge gleitet und man darf einfach keinen Druck ausüben.Der Schnitt ist lächerlich im Gegensatz zu Mehrklingen Rasierer.Ich bin absoluter Fan und werde nur noch den Rasierhobel verwenden.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I've always used cartridge based razers like Gillette but I figured I'd try a safety razor for a change. After the first shave I am already very impressed by both the shave, how easy it is to use and the affordability. Not only are the blades easy to swap and clean when compared to cartridges, they are incredibly cheap. You can get a box of a 100 for a just a few quid online and save yourself a lot of dosh.The Gillette and Wilkinson's cartridge brands are good, no doubt, but they are expensive and cannot be recycled and end up just filling up landfills. The blades I've used for this are both cheaper, easier to clean and give a clean cut that easily rivals your common razor brand. It is incredible. The weight of the razor is not too heavy, but the material used gives it a heftiness that makes it feel premium despite the affordable price point. It comes with 5 blades which should last you a while.It also may take a shave or two to adjust to the razor, especially how much pressure you need to exert to shave. I recommend a wet shave if you have coarse facial hair with a considerable dollop of shaving foam for the first go or so, primarily to get used to how much friction you need to apply to shave. I only nicked myself once on my first go, so if you're patient and consider yourself a decent shaver with a steady hand, you should be absolutely fine. While the blades aren't particularly sharp or painful to use, they can still give you a nasty cut if you're not careful.The blades are also easy to replace too, you just twist the head of the razor off and insert the blade, twist it back on and voila.I can't sing this products praise more. I regret not buying one years ago.
